website_summaries.verdict: Fast and easy blade change, balanced weight, and intuitive shave angle.
pros: Shaves smooth, with minimal irritation regardless of blade type
Blade changing is very easy, with one-twist butterfly open and close
Razor handle is weighty but well balanced
cons: Blade angle can be inconsistent between changes, requiring caution when first beginning each shave
Butterfly open and close mechanism doesn’t lock down tightly

customer_reviews.title: Elegant, Ergonomic, and Precise... A Functional & Form-factor centered dream dream to use.
customer_reviews.text: The Chieftan Razor is pure ergonomic bliss in a travel-friendly size! The fit & finish, packaging, attention to detail, and build quality are beyond compare (coming from an admitted perfectionist, this is the highest level of praise I could offer)! The weight and balance of the razor is perfect. The design is elegant, refined and perfect in form and function. In comparison to the Godfather Safety Razor, this is easier / safer to load, and offers an equivalent shave. The shorter handle makes the razor more travel friendly, sacrificing only a little on the precision and control offered by the Godfather model.
customer_reviews.author: Ian James

customer_reviews.title: Ok I failed to read the Reddit first
customer_reviews.text: Paid $35 bucks for an $8 ebay razor shame on me. Do a little Googling so you dont make the same mistake just Google Viking Razor Reddit, you will find it. The razor is ok, but would have gotten alot more from Italian barber. I didnt do my homework.
customer_reviews.author: gatorengineer

customer_reviews.title: Vikings Blade Chieftain Safety Razor
customer_reviews.text: I love the butterfly opening for easy replacement of blades, but that was it. This is a cheaply made chinese safety razor. The finish feels very cheap. I wasn't impressed with its performance and did return. I ended up getting a German made safety razor with the butterfly opening from Duluth Trading Company that performed much better for the same price and they include a LIFETIME satisfaction guarantee .It has a beautiful finish and much better blades I'm shocked that this chinese made product has such high reviews. I usually rely on the reviews, but this one is an exception. Don't be fooled by the high praise of this product, as I believe most of the feedback are shill reviews
customer_reviews.author: TRUMP 2020

customer_reviews.title: which gives me a close comfortable shave when used with the right blade
customer_reviews.text: This razor craves blood! I compare it with my Feather, which gives me a close comfortable shave when used with the right blade, and with my Merkur, which never fails me. This razor is too heavy, clunky, and savage. Having given it three tries with the “Swedish blades” bundled in the package, and having followed the enclosed shaving directions to the letter, this razor cut my face up. Greater care and cauction in the second and third tries were no better. Left me pained, even on the unsliced areas of face. Used their brush and “soap”, too. Recommend: Leave this one alone. Pass it by. Sorry to say.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Plant

customer_reviews.title: Not for coarse hair. Still causes razerburn.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased because of all the reviews saying how great it was for people with sensitive skin. This product could not even cut through my mustache stubble. It was honestly the toughest shave I’ve ever had and left me with all kinds of razerburn. If you purchase this and have even slightly course hair be sure to purchase new blades or you’ll have a bad time.
customer_reviews.author: lane tunstall

customer_reviews.title: Looks Great . Shave wise not very functional.
customer_reviews.text: I was a first time user. I saw the 5 star ratings that led me to this razor. Upon arrival i noticed it was well packaged and looked of high quality. Placing it in my hand i noticed it is very heavy and i mean heavy. The second thing i noticed as well was the handle is very short. i do not have large hands. But you cant easily manipulate the razor while shaving and its hard to control. Looks are fantastic, functionality is bad. Im not happy with those two things other then that i am.
customer_reviews.author: swbrown69

customer_reviews.title: DONT DO IT IF YOU HAVE SENSITIVE SKIN
customer_reviews.text: I DECIDED TO TRY BASED ON THE POSITIVES REVIEWS, HOWEVER IT DIDNT WORK FOR ME. IT LEAVES MY FACE VERY IRRITATERD AND BLEEDING SPECIALLY IN THE NECK AREA, IM GOING BACK TO GULLET
customer_reviews.author: Darien

customer_reviews.title: JUNK OVERPRICED RAZOR! Research other razors and see!
customer_reviews.text: Razor is junk. The blades are junk too! They bribe people after buying it with warranty extensions after you post a good review on Amazon and send them the link. It’s waaay overpriced! If you’re just starting out shaving with a DE safety razor, DO YOUR RESEARCH! Get a Merkur 34C, which is a great, solid razor that’s made in Germany, and is pretty much everyone’s go to razor when starting out. It’s most people’s daily shaved even! It’s also CHEAPER than this junk! Get a razor sampler pack along with it. This razor is overpriced junk! They bought/bribed for their good reviews on Amazon. Look at Merkur razors and you’ll see what I mean!
customer_reviews.author: ProtectURSelf

customer_reviews.title: Great for ladies too
customer_reviews.text: This razor is great. Good weight, nice finish & craftsmanship. But do yourself a favor and get yourself some good blades like Astra and a good shave gel. As the package insert states, the blades in this set are more like “training” blades and are “less aggressive” (less sharp). Personally, they gave me a bit too much pull & irritation on my hair while shaving. That being said, I’m a beginner to using safety razors and with the correct blade I’ve had no nicks, cuts or issues. Gives a comfortable & nice shave every time. Its an excellent and affordable choice. I did a lot of research prior to deciding on this one and am glad this was my choice.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: wasted money.
customer_reviews.text: Had it for about 2 months now. The closing mechanism bends the blade which makes it very hard to shave. I thought the problem was due to aldull blade but I added a brand new one and still hurts when I shave. I am not a novice. Being shaving for years. Can’t return...wasted money. :(
customer_reviews.author: Deena opp

customer_reviews.title: Brutal
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe all of these outstanding reviews. This may the worst razor I've used. See the huge blade gap in the photo. The Viking is on the left and an Above The Tie on the right. This was a very aggressive shave; my face was sore all day.
customer_reviews.author: Vilhjálmur

customer_reviews.title: First time user of safety blade
customer_reviews.text: My first impressions were great for this razor. The quality is definitely many steps up from a cartridge razor. It comes in a nice box and several trainer blades that are meant to be mild so first time users don't cut themselves. It also has a nice weight to it and I love the butterfly latches. I don't shave my entire face, but only the side of my face and the neck area occasionally. I don't shave with any cream or products. I simply put hot water on my face and shave. When I used this razor, it got me a close shave, and I went against the grain and got an even closer shave!
customer_reviews.author: Sabur

customer_reviews.title: Made in ROC and difficut to close
customer_reviews.text: It is made in China and unlike my 60 year old made in USA Gillette razor that was my father, it takes several attempt to close. The blade just does settle. This is NOT and issue with my Gillette. I bought this because I did not want to rish taking my USA or Germany razors with me while I am over seas. I would up leaving it and just using disposable blades for the 2 years. It is OK I use English made blade that work well.
customer_reviews.author: Not_you

customer_reviews.title: Thing of beauty
customer_reviews.text: I hate the trend towards razors with more and more blades. My favorite brand only had 2, but it became hard to find. So, I gave this safety razor a try. There was no learning curve beyond watching a few videos. I have never nicked my self. I upgraded to the Astra blades to get rid of the scraping feeling. Gives a good looking shave, but maybe the stubble comes back faster than it used to. It’s a beautiful art deco style. Seems to be very well made and durable. I’m never going back to multibladed monstrosities.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis T.

customer_reviews.title: Shaver supreme
customer_reviews.text: Beautifully crafted shaver that has great balance and simplicity. I am a 80 year old man who learned to shave on my dad's double edge razor. In recent years I have used an electric razor thinking fast shaving is better. Now I am learning to enjoy shaving once again. The Viking was a gift from my wife who spent time investigating the best shavers. She decided on the Viking and I am delighted. I am once again enjoying a shave that has the potential to last two days. Thanks Viking for a great shave again.
customer_reviews.author: flyway

customer_reviews.title: Look's very nice
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, the appearance and marketing , is all this razor has going for it. I have been shaving with double edge safety razors for twenty of mt forty years of shaving. I have a Edwin Jagger that is a very nice razor , but the ivory handle can be slippery at times. My attempt here was to find a razor that had a very tactile handle. The handle is fine, but the mechanism to open the razor to change blades seems flimsy at best. The area of blade exposure seems larger on this razor giving it more opportunity to cut me., I really wanted to like a razor called The Chieftain, as I am Scottish.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY FROM THIS RAZOR
customer_reviews.text: Not a good razor this one is not safe to use, it cut your face all over, this razor is heavy, bulky, weights a lot and is useless, when you put a new blade (any brand), and close the wings of the razor the angle where the blade sits is not the correct one (is more straighter than in other razors), that is why it nicks, scratch and cut your face when you shave with it, very uncomfortable shaving experience with this Vikings Razor “STAY AWAY” from this razor not recommended. Better get the MicroTouch One, far way better shaving experience, and at a more affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not just for "beginners"
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the safety razor 'seen on TV' for several years because I hate the disposables and see no point to needing 3, 4, or more blades to shave around my middle-age- guy goatee. Finally took a chance on the Chieftain because the other shaver constantly loosens up while in use. Not Cool. Too bad I can't pawn it off.... Have had no issues with the Chieftain. The weight is substantial but not stupid heavy, the grip is textured, and the twist-lock seems to hold well. Meaning I don't have to retighten the blade holder in the middle of a shave. The provided blades are a bit draggy, I'll try the Feather or Merkur next.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Shave GOOD Mechanical Function NOT SO GOOD!
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to get this razor. I expected it to be my new go-to travel razor, since I had such a wonderful experience with The Godfather from the same company. To be clear, this razor shaves EXCELLENT. There are no issues with its ability to perform the function. My issue is with the mechanical workings of the butterfly mechanism. It is VERY clunky, noisy, and feels CHEAP. I paid a little over $40 US for this razor. Prior to it, I only had a Van Der Hagen butterfly that I bought at grocery for $7 US. The VDH is SMOOTH in its operation. I expected better quality from The Chieftain in mechanical function.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Clark

customer_reviews.title: Instant favorite!
customer_reviews.text: The original chieftain razor has been my favorite razor for a few years now. My first thought about the chieftain 5BC was that it would be just like the original one ( as far as the shave goes). But it's even smoother and more efficient than the original one! Don't know how they did it as the original one is an incredible razor. I love the anti-misalignment mechanism in Vikings blades's razors. One thing I really hate is when I struggle just to get proper blade alignment on a razor. I would recommend this one. Just for the looks it's worth it. It has really nice heft, Wich makes it even easier to shave with. Super happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Edward J

customer_reviews.title: Shaving has finally become fun!
customer_reviews.text: I generally hate shaving. I have stupid sensitive skin and ridiculously coarse neck hair that a Gillette blade never could quite shave down, always leaving behind stubble. A friend recommended I try a safety razor instead as the shave is usually closer than a cartridge shave. I did some research and found this one, and I'm so glad I did. I love this razor. The colors are awesome, it's nicely weighted. I bought different blades because the ones that come with it were too weak for my stubble. Shaving has finally become something I look forward too instead of dreading.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked Perfectly... For 1 Year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this almost exactly 2 years ago. It worked great and I loved it for the first year, but over the second year the butterfly mechanism has seized up more and more until it is unusable. It is now to the point that I need a wrench to twist the bottom in order to change the blade. My guess is that something inside the handle has rusted so it no longer can open or close the head. Won't be buying another one, time to switch brands.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Scam. These Viking's Blade products are a scam.
customer_reviews.text: I was new to wet shaving two years ago. The Amazon reviews seemed to make my decision for me! Viking's Blade! The best company in traditional wet shaving and safety razors! Nonsense. Utter hogwash. This exact same (it is the EXACT same razor) is available at Maggard Razors (where you ought to be buying your wet shaving gear, not on Amazon) under the name Baili BR-179 for $6.45. That's right. Less than seven dollars! Go google it for yourself. This is a scam. You are being robbed. Do not buy products from these people.
customer_reviews.author: Steven K Kline

customer_reviews.title: I'm not yet sure.
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate the craftsmanship of trhis razor. It's quite solid. I am not yet sure how to rate it since the initial shipment came with five "mild" blades. My continuing education in shaving (almost for 60 years now) has shown that for my coarse, wiry beard, most blades are too subtle. I am prepared to order a box of your Cayenne hot blades. At present my shave is a little better than with my old Gilette double blade razor and the sample pack of various blades I got from Amazon, but I have hopes that your sharper blades will get me back to a baby-bottom jowl line.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E. Ruddick

customer_reviews.title: Very Bespoke.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something better than the usual razors you get at a large chain store. This safety razor style was just what I was looking for. After reading he reviews, I decided to purchase. I was pleased with the packaging. It came in a reusable box with a small mirror. The quality of the razor itself was excellent. I used the mild blades that it came with. These are more for someone who hasn’t use this type of razor before. It gave me the best shave I’ve ever done for myself. It compares to a barber shave. I will not use any other razor now.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Miller

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST BRAND ON THE PLANET!
customer_reviews.text: I have several of this company's products and have yet to find a dislike with any of them, if you are tired of spending way to much money on terrible unsatisfactory razors, then this is it look no further. Spend the money now to save money and time latter! Very close smooth save, handles nicely, it feels balanced when I glide it across my face the razor does the work for you, very effortless. Pay the money learn how to use it!!! You will not be dissatisfied. Now I am in interested in there adjustable version oh my!!
customer_reviews.author: BunLength77

customer_reviews.title: beautiful
customer_reviews.text: shaves as good as it looks !! and that very rare in todays market .. i am new to DE razors and had ZERO issues with my first shave and it has only become better...i am still using the viking blades, but bought a combo assortment of different blades.. truth be told, i'm happy with the supplied blades..but you don't know until you try.. UPDATE .. i continue to be amazed..i have got to wonder why we ever stopped using these razors ? just get one, its cheaper and better than disposable razors..and looks cool... win win win !
customer_reviews.author: flht3

customer_reviews.title: Great craftsmanship. Best shave I've ever had.
customer_reviews.text: The handle and head are very precise in the craftsmanship. It's heavier than any other razor I've ever had which helps me remember not to press like disposable razors. The first time I used it I was a little nervous as others have said since it is a totally different experience than using disposable razors. But after following the directions I realized how easy it actually is. It also does a much better job and uses little effort to get a smoother and closer shave. Plus the refill blades come in large quantity packs and will last me a very long time while spending less then disposable razors.
customer_reviews.author: James Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Chieftain > Godfather
customer_reviews.text: My first Vikings Blade razor was the Godfather and that served me well for a little over 3 years, but after that much time and my lack of care with threading the 3-piece design together, I wore out the threads and that razor failed me... it was at this point that Vikings Blade's amazing customer service sprang into action! They generously offered me a discount on a replacement even though I was past the warranty period so I opted to get the Chieftain since the butterfly design shouldn't be as susceptible to the alignment issues of a 3-piece razor. I am so pleased with the quality of the razor and like it even more than the Godfather! Cannot recommend enough.
customer_reviews.author: The Critical Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Great Shave, Great Balance
customer_reviews.text: What a nicely balanced razor. I've used a double edged razor for about 7 years after running the gamut of 5 blade and electric shavers for decades. I've gone through two DE razors (Edwin Jagger three piece) that eventually failed on the screw threads. I thought I'd research the butterfly razors for better longevity as these things aren't cheap. Glad I did. Balance is better on this, nicks with new blades are gone. Overall excellent close shave. Same price as the Jagger but much closer BBS for me. Should have a longer overall life span with the butterfly loading. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: The best !
customer_reviews.text: Way better than a disposable razor . It can shave off a beard or any amount of hair without getting clogged . Easy to rinse and immediately is unclogged . What would've taken maybe 45 min. with a disposable razor and then you have to just give up and use an electric razor now takes maybe 10 min and no effort and no stubble left ! The chieftain opens up , does not come apart . Which is way better I think ! The best experience with this product and don't know why these went out of style . The box it came in was a nice touch also !
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Nice Item, NOT for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: This was a very aesthetic product. It felt nice in the hand, but it is not at all a viable option if you're shaving larger areas (i.e. legs, bikini lines, armpits, etc). It's very time consuming and slow to use, and the learning curve is way higher than expected. Not an easy product to get used to - and I've given it a few trials. I wouldn't trust this anywhere near sensitive bits until after a higher level of mastery is achieved. The shave was close, but the Schick I was using before was a smoother shave. TLDR; very neat tool, but time consuming and not as close of a shave as other razors.
customer_reviews.author: Brie Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about how a single blade could be better compared to the 3-5 blade razors I previously used, but this product is incredible. I was delighted to find there was 5 blades included with the product and grateful that they were "mild" blades. I have been developing my skill with the single blade and just now (8 shaves done) feeling confidant. Takes some practice but for sure worth it. Less irritation and even with a "mild" blade its a better shave. I would suggest this product to anyone, matter of fact I told 2 of my friends after only 3 shaves how amazing it was. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jay Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Can't wait for the Next Shave!
customer_reviews.text: Shaving is a necessary pain in the ass and a waste of time. Until now. By all standards, I have a light beard, and if if I miss a day of shaving no one notices. I can get away with 2-3 days without shaving. That used to be a nice advantage. Now, I Can't Wait for My Next Shave! I love my new shaving experience and Enjoy taking a few more moments to savor the process. The Chieftan feels good in my hands, that's all I need to say. Seriously, guys, this is one, smooth shave. I have to wait an extra day to shave again....it does such a good job. Damn.
customer_reviews.author: Chazz

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner safety razor!
customer_reviews.text: The razor feels sturdy, solid and durable. It is well made and easy to operate and clean. I am new to using a safety razor and I was able to purchase it for the same price that I would have paid for cartridge refills, which is why I made the switch. You definitely need to let the razor do the work and not force it across your face. The process takes a little longer than cartridge razors but not that much longer and the experience is more enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: TarukaS

customer_reviews.title: DANGER warning!! Don't shave your head with it
customer_reviews.text: I've shaved my head for over 20 years and I've been looking for a Gillette Mach 3 replacement so I bought a Vikings Blade. I don't know if I was the first one ever to attempt shaving my head with it but I stopped after two strokes...I was scalping myself!!! (literally, see image) Anyone else out there use this blade on their head? I'd assume it'd be safe to do so and probably with great results but I was wrong. Not saying it is a bad product at all, just sharing my experience in case someone else had similar results then Vikings should put a warning on their blades. Or share how to safely shave our head.
customer_reviews.author: ferSal

customer_reviews.title: Good, long-lasting razor.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this razor for several years and it works great, no issues with it. The chrome is not pitting or chipping. The only thing is that this razor can be a bit on the aggressive-cutting side in comparison to traditional 3 piece razors in which the head detaches from the handle.The blades that come with it are mild, and are, therefore somewhat pull-y and tend to irritate skin if you have a thick beard like I do. I use feather and astra blades and it does wonders (though i still get cut up a lot.) Never buying regular cartridge type razors or blades again.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, easy to use, short handle which is perfect for use.
customer_reviews.text: It's a gorgeous razor, crafted beautifully and so easy to use. 1st time using it no Nick's or cuts. The Cheiftain has the shorter handle which I love. It came in a beautiful box and the butterfly opening is so easy to use. Just spin the bottom of the handle the top opens up and slide the blade on top and close and spin it closed again. Very simple and well crafted. If you are looking for a shorter handle razor with one single blade you cant go wrong with this one. Viking is the best. They also have longer handles too if you are more comfortable with that.
customer_reviews.author: CHADMD

customer_reviews.title: First-time Safety Razor User
customer_reviews.text: Came in today and everything works great and looks very nice. I noticed some complaints on here about the blades that it comes with not being sharp and causing some tugging, but Viking specifies that the razors they send with it are for first time users and are intentionally mild, so don't let that deter you. Even with the mild blades, I got a fine shave and didn't experience much tugging, plus you can equip different blades easily. As long as the butterfly hinge mechanisms don't loosen over time or the metal doesn't degrade then I can safely say this is a razor I'm looking forward to being able to use for a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Lindauer

customer_reviews.title: Garbage design.  Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: If you are interested in a razor that pulls out hair without cutting it, causes razor burn but has no problem slicing through your skin from even the slightest horizontal jerk look no further for this pile of crap is it! Spent a solid two weeks using this thing with multiple blades and shaving at various angles and my conclusion is it belongs in the trash. If you are looking for a razor that DOESN'T carve your face up like a Christmas ham, I would recommend using the following razor and blades:
customer_reviews.author: david price

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: The razor is not bad, but not that great either. It's kinda average. It is quite aggressive and if you don't have the technique down, it is quite easy to cut yourself with it. The shave is ok, but not the best out there. One problem for me is washing it while shaving. No matter how you wash it, if you lather up a good foam, the gaps in the razor for washing are not enough and a fairly large amount of lather stays inside the razor.
customer_reviews.author: S.V. Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Never going back to multi blade junk
customer_reviews.text: I’m never going back to disposables, ever. I took the leap after reading up on safety razors. I’ve never used one before and thought I’d be a bloody mess the first time. Not at all! Was actually pleasant to use, just made a nice larger and went with the grain. Too easy. I even shaved my head lol. Not one nick. I’m a customer for life. Shaving is something I look forward too instead of dreading dragging those multi blade face peelers across myself. 5 Stars, no question.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Scott

customer_reviews.title: Not so difficult better than I thought
customer_reviews.text: I used this safety razor as soon as I got it. I didnt want to wait for the soap brush and bowl to arrive. I was scared and nervous because I'm so used to using cartridge razors. Scared of knicking myself since I'm on blood thinners. Well I didnt cut myself. Just had to be extra careful while shaving. The balance is nice. You know you're holding a significant blade. Not too heavy and very balanced. Smoothest and closest shave I have had in a while. Smoother and closer than my electric shaver. Easy peasy!
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Small learning curve
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful razor. I never used a safety razor before, but I will never go back to disposable razors again. I shaved my legs and lady parts in little time. Everything was very smooth. I did nick my legs a few times, as I hadn’t quite gotten down how to position the razor or how to not apply pressure - old habits. But I was so very smooth! The true test is I will have my boyfriend use it, he shaves his head every few days and his goatee. I curious to see what he thinks.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi Blue

customer_reviews.title: A decent product.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for 4 months now, and it's fine. Hard to know how it compares to others, as I've only tried this one, but it's hard to imagine that any other product could be much better. They are very simple, and it's hard to mess them up, if well made. This one seems to be. BTW, I did buy a very cheap one first, ($6.00) and it didn't even open! The materials and workmanship seem excellent. Ask me again in 20 years, and I'll know for sure. The 5 blades that come with it each lasted about 6 shaves, and seem to work very nicely. Again, nothing else to compare them with.
customer_reviews.author: Tom B.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: I just got my chieftain in the mail. It arrived quick and easy. It sooo shiny! I cant wait to shave. Update: Few days shaving with this now. Blade sits perfectly. Mechanism is smooth and feels strong. I am very happy with this razor. Beats the daylights out of the cheapo’ razor I was using. Highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Keyser

customer_reviews.title: Great Shave
customer_reviews.text: It's a beautiful razor. I hadn't shaved in quite a prior to using this razor and I know that when I go a long time without shaving It's quite uncomfortable when I finally do shave. However, that was not the case with this razor. It was a pretty smooth and comfortable shave. Sure, I got a few tiny cuts around my neck, but that's the case with me no matter what razor I use. I would highly recommend this razor!
customer_reviews.author: Joel Spring

customer_reviews.title: awesome product
customer_reviews.text: i bought this razor for my father he's 87 years old. He had his previous razor for 40+ years. I told him let me get you a new one so I googled this razor it had positive feedbacks. My father is very happy he says it glides easily on the facial hair with one stroke it does its job. He mentioned it to his friend and had me order another one. The price is awesome and the shipping time was as mentioned. Actually I received it a week before the date mentioned. Highly highly recommended. Thanks for making these awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: NRuiz

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous, solidly built razor that leaves skin healthier
customer_reviews.text: After one month of use: While I have indeed nicked myself a number of times learning to use this razor, its quality and weight are apparent. I have no doubt that with practice I will be able to use the Chieftain with greater ease. I do believe it will always take a few extra minutes to shave my legs than it did with my old Venus, but that is a fair price to pay for NO razor burn... My skin feels and looks healthier, especially around my bikini line (which is prone to razor burn). I'd highly recommend this if you're considering switching away from plastic...
customer_reviews.author: kassie sarr

customer_reviews.title: Amazing shaving experience
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Just WOW! This razor was well worth the price in my opinion. I am new to wet shaving with de razors. I had tried a basic razor initially and it did not perform well for myself. The Chieftain was a home run! It is so well built, smooth as butter with my Stirling shave soap. It is an absolute pleasure to use and I look forward to shaving every morning. I would absolutely buy one again and recommend anyone thinking about it to just go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Cafoster23

customer_reviews.title: Great razor, fussy butterfly
customer_reviews.text: I like the feel and heft of the razor and the fact it never gets slippery, even when wet. The one issue I have with this razor is that the butterfly lid often does not close without some adjusting. I have other razors with this type of opening and do not experience any difficulty closing the top after installing a blade. It does eventually close, but almost always after trying a few times. Perhaps it is the blades sent with the razor, I'll test that in the very near future. But overall, it's a really good razor it's just that the butterfly does not close as easily as I believe it should.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: No Buyer's Remorse Here
customer_reviews.text: I've read plenty of reviews stating that these are the same exact razors as the Baili. Although they may be made in the same factory, it doesn't mean they are the same exact razor. The head has a unique size with features that the cheaper brand doesn't have and just gives you a better shave. It also is made of slightly heavier metal and feels like a superior product. It has that heft that inferior quality products just don't have. I also own several EJ and Merkur razors and this Viking razor is every bit as good if not better in quality and shaves better too.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Sarfati

customer_reviews.title: Great razor. Requires a little skill.
customer_reviews.text: A bit of nostalgia from when dad would shave, and a little bit of thriftiness from lower cost of refill blades. Wanted a butterfly opening type, because that what dad used. Used one when I first started growing chin hairs in the 70s. Used this the first time since then, and cut myself in 12 places. Let it heal for a week. Got some shaving soap and a brush. Filled the sink with hot water, and did it right. No cuts. Super close shave. Reminded me of old days. There is a little bit of skill required, but remember just to let the weight of the razor do the cutting. Don’t press. I love it. Will use it forever.
customer_reviews.author: Tucker Mac

customer_reviews.title: Mild razor.
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty new to wet shaving. That being said this is my third razor. Not a bad razor. I compared it to a 1963 "slim" . The craftsmanship is lacking next to it. It works okay but not nearly as smooth as the vintage slim. Again not a bad,mild shave. Razor doesn't feel bad. Just don't think it will last for years of use. Finish is pretty nice. Comes in nice small case. Might be a little over priced. All that said, we all like or dislike different razors for different reasons. You can only tell so much by reviews. Shaving with it is the only real test.
customer_reviews.author: mark carns

customer_reviews.title: Not for those with sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I like to shave with a razor and I wanted an alternative to the very expensive multi blade razors that have taken over the market. I am older with thinning skin (but very experienced with this type of razor), so I was cautious, but I still had numerous cuts and nicks. I don’t recommend this product for older users or for those with thin, sensitive skin.
customer_reviews.author: Lamar

customer_reviews.title: Perfection is here
customer_reviews.text: This is the absolute MOST BEAUTIFUL razor you'll find - at any price. It'll need your love because it will give your face and\or scalp more love than you can imagine! Great feel, well balanced in the hand and almost glides over your head. Give the finest shave of any other razor I could find (except The Vikings Blade Godfather finishes within a nose of Odin. If you don't buy this razor now then your next shave will never be as perfect as it could be.

customer_reviews.title: Better than awesome
customer_reviews.text: So I got this razor to augment/replace my current one that needs a serious cleaning. Anyway, I thought the overall design would be just ok, but when it finally arrived it was instantly a classic. The brass head looks amazing. The weight is great. The only downside (and I attribute it to getting to know the razor) is that it feels like it is pulling at my hair instead of gliding smoothly over the skin. Honestly, that could be just me needing to get a better feel of the optimal cutting angle. Once I have that down I will possibly change it to a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made meme brand
customer_reviews.text: Impulse buy for a travel razor. Used once: cut my face to shreds ... and somehow manage to not cut the hair off my face. And ... as it turns out, it's actually an $8 pot metal razor; yay. If I hadn't thrown the packaging away already, I would have asked Amazon for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Scott C. Locklin

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful mild razor for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful, well-crafted mild razor. I am still fairly new to wet shaving with a safety razor and this razor and included blades are wonderful. I hardly get any nicks and if I do, I blame my inexperience rather than the razor. Taking your time, doing a good pre-shave preparation and using a good shaving lathering soap with this razor will give a very satisfying shave. I no longer get any shave bumps or skin issues that I was having with cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Ochoa

customer_reviews.title: I was so tired of throwing out disposable razors with good blades just because it’s too tedious to clean it ...
customer_reviews.text: This razor is a game changer! I was so tired of throwing out disposable razors with good blades just because it’s too tedious to clean it all the hair! This design allows the hair to pass through as you go. What ever is stuck inside easily gets washed out. I cut my self a few times because the blades are so sharp, and those are just the trainer blades! Females, get you one. You won’t be sorry! *the only complaint I have is because it’s so sharp you have to be very well lathered up. The short handle does not grip very well. So you just have to be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Hangrab Wiltonferro

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Razor
customer_reviews.text: Been using a cheap safety razor for about a year now and have been looking for a new razor. Decided to give this one a go and quality of the razor and the cut it gives is superb. Weight is great, feels good in the hand and holds the blade well. Really enjoying this razor and looks like it will last a long time. I was worried it would be to "pink", but once I received the razor it looks perfect. I did not try the trainer blades that were included, but even with a cheap regular blade it gave a great cut. I will be trying some of the blades Viking Blades offers as soon as I need more.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this razor
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this razor. The website gives simple instructions, and the best thing, no more buying razor after razor, and expensive blades. After just some foamy soap and learning the technique I have just as soft non-stubbly legs as any other razor, with more ease because of the weight of the razor. Thank you Vikings Blade, I know you where meant for men, but as a woman, I approve! <3
customer_reviews.author: Pips

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: Girl perspective- Really nice razor. Had an Edwin Jagger before and feel this one is a bit more aggressive, but the shave is smoother. It's heavier, which I like but more slippery when soapy or wet. I like that it opens up rather than a three piece, don't have to worry about dropping a piece. I would not recommend to a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: kbalboa730

customer_reviews.title: Prefered razor
customer_reviews.text: The Chieftain (Odin edition) most comfortable shave I've had so far. Mostly do to more modern razors tend to grab hair and proceed to cut flesh not hair. That's just issue with my hair being difficult to cut, witch is why I tried the Viking blades and no longer use they to mild to cut hair without cutting flesh for me. I have been using a safety razor for last 4-6 years at this point. I use Feather blades and seems to do a very clean cut without grabbing. So far best experience in chore of shaving thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Tangorat

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Razor
customer_reviews.text: Really liked this razor, but just not for me. I ended up picking up an Electric hybrid which works for the heavy lifting and I just use some of those cheap razors to finish up the job. However, with that being said, if I had time in my morning routine to lather up a bunch of shaving cream and do the whole ritual-- this is a top notch, well made tool to get the job done. Might pick one up in the future. Very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Mike & Claudin

customer_reviews.title: Great product from a great family business!
customer_reviews.text: I own several razors, am partial to safety razors, and this is one of the best! While I certainly appreciate the quality, craftsmanship, and finish of the razor, the purchase was only enhanced but the charm of the family as evidenced in their emails and website. It may just be clever marketing, but it is certainly a very refreshing pitch and effectively makes you want to support such a charming enterprise! Just a nice experience and I am pleased the product actually delivers a fine shave!
customer_reviews.author: Longbowsafari

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Razor
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for over a month now and I shave my legs twice a week. I go a little slower and take some time to dry it and store it properly after each use and it is easily worth the extra time. In what I have saved in disposable cartridges, this razor has already paid for itself. My legs are smooth and I feel better about using less plastic and creating less trash for the landfills.
customer_reviews.author: C. M. McKeown

customer_reviews.title: My Dad had his Dad's, and it's in my Mom's house, 1800 miles away.  This one is mine...
customer_reviews.text: This is reminiscent - but better-finished - of the pot-metal ones my Dad had. He had two: one was screw-on (three-piece), and one like this (butterfly action). Both were a flat-metal (gray) finish, really didn't need knurling to help the grip (but they were diamond pattern knurled). I like the blade angle and smoothness/closeness of shave with this, but this is a personal preference. Feels good in my hand. It had no trouble with 2 weeks' growth (about 1/2") the very first time I used it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Howell

customer_reviews.title: Nice razor
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy . A nice brass closed comb TTO razor. Fairly aggressive. I realize there are similar brands for less, but I've also paid more for razors that don't shave as well. Very nice presentation to boot. Update: As I continue to use this razor, I am quite impressed. This is very likely the best closed comb razor I own. Works well with any blade. A great value, really.
customer_reviews.author: GMS

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic razor!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first safety razor and it was the perfect choice. It's very well made and stylish and the blades that come with it are perfect for beginners. I've cut myself less with this razor than with disposables and oddly the cuts don't seem to bleed as much. If this is your first time with a safety razor there are many good videos online to give you the basics and it would be well worth your time to take a look.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I love your product line . After buying and using the razor and brush, i also purchased the shaving bowl and another razor with the longer handle. The stainless steel bowl is great with the higher sides and I no longer have to push the lather back in the bowl. i really love the butterfly opening as i received a bad cut when my hand slipped trying to loosen my old safety razor. As i use up my soaps and pre-shave i will definitely try more of your line. Great Job,thanks NP
customer_reviews.author: NP

customer_reviews.title: Sending back...not a good razor.
customer_reviews.text: Update: after further research, this is China made garbage. Same razor is being sold for less than $10. Just Google it. It's all marketing nonsense. These razors are NOT patented. Ask for a patent number...see where you get. I'm sorry...but it's going back. Just a very mild/weak razor. I used three different razor blades. I had literally a rough face. I tried one more time last night...I used same blade. One side Chieftain and other Edwin Jagger. Jagger absolutely destroyed this razor. Not even close.
customer_reviews.author: Azzurri

customer_reviews.title: Great For Face/Neck, But Not Head
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in shaving my head with it. The areas of my face and neck that I shave are fine. But that's easy when you're bearded and only shave your neck and small areas of face. It's difficult and clumsy when shaving my head though. It's quite top heavy and I'm always paranoid of nicking/cutting myself. I've practiced shaving my head with it several times now, and still don't care for it. I'll likely give it a couple more chances, in an effort to adjust to it.
customer_reviews.author: Heath Ceglio

customer_reviews.title: Do it, you won’t be sorry
customer_reviews.text: This feels very sturdy, I like the butterfly closure for the blade compartment. This is my first safety razor so I don’t have much to compare it to but I can tell you I think switching was a great decision. My legs are really smooth, blades are super cheap and even though I’m inexperienced I did not cut myself, I was just slow and cautious. I think anyone wanting to switch to a safety razor is making a smart decision.
customer_reviews.author: Poodlelicious81

customer_reviews.title: Twist handle operates poorly
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a butterfly type razor and this seemed to fit the bill. However, right out of the box the twist mechanism was very rough and felt like it was rubbing on something internally. I contacted the company and they said to put a few drops of oil on it but I'm not liking this at all. Returned the product and will shop for something else.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisR

customer_reviews.title: Good razor but not for me
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this style of razor for quite sometime, and dropped my old and and needed a replacement. Thinking this would be an excellent replacement. It is an excellently crafted razor so in that regard I have zero complaints. Unfortunately this razor is simply not aggressive enough for my style of facial hair. In order to get a clean shave so much pressure is needed my skin gets simply shredded. And, of course i have already discarded all the packaging material making a return difficult. I will need to order a new fully open comb razor. All in all a good razor just not what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: This shorter handled one fits me better. I like the way this one opens up ...
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a fancy presentation, though the mirror inside the box was a bit scuffed up on mine. I was using the Merkur long handle, but it never felt quite right for me. This shorter handled one fits me better. I like the way this one opens up for blade changing. I was worried it might come open on its own, but the twist handle stays in place. I agree with the maker that Feather blades are the best, they tell you the ones included with the razor are not very aggressive and I agree. Hard to place why, but they don't feel quite as sharp as the Feather blades I'm used to, which would be good for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Even sported a beard for a few years but my wife jumped for joy the day I shaved it off
customer_reviews.text: At 77 years of age I am hardly new to shaving. Over the years I have tried many shaving methods including double edge, five blade, three blade and electric. Even sported a beard for a few years but my wife jumped for joy the day I shaved it off. There is no doubt in my mind that the Viking Blade Chiefton handle paired with Feather blades is the best shave ever. The most important thing to remember is very light pressure. After all you are attacking your face with an extremely sharp blade and it doesn't take much to cut a hair. But with care you can get a no nicks or cuts comfortable and close shave.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B. Drake

customer_reviews.title: Got stubble? Use this. Stubble be gone.
customer_reviews.text: I've used cartridge razors for decades until the wastefulness irked me enough to switch to this. The shave is INCREDIBLE. Very smooth, doesn't irritate the skin. I'll never shave with anything else ever again. And I'm not polluting the environment throwing cartridges away on the regular, which is a HUGE plus. On the downside, the wife hates it, as she finds it unsuitable to shave her legs, etc., which is a bummer, but I love it, so.... five stars. It's a WINNER!
customer_reviews.author: M. Goerg

customer_reviews.title: blades are fine, the razor was junk
customer_reviews.text: the head of this razor simply doesnt work. You cant adjust it. A teeny tiny adjustment makes it useless. I trashed it and went back to the simple walmart brand. This isnt a problem with the blades of course, but with the razor design itself
customer_reviews.author: gradyman

customer_reviews.title: Not a BD179...but really, what's the difference?
customer_reviews.text: I feel like the razor is too mild even for beginners. It shaves well enough though. The reason it's only 2 stars is because this is basically a $37 Baili. Vikings blade attempts to quell this "rumor" with an explanation on their website and the account is totally believable. Here's the thing though...It's still the same people working in the same factory that make the Baili regardless of who owns the molds. It also happens to look exactly like the BD179 which costs less than half as much as the chieftain.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy E.

customer_reviews.title: Good looking well designed but gave cuts
customer_reviews.text: I used this product with the astra blades and it gave cuts. I had to stop and go back to use my old razor. I’m not sure if it’s an aggressive and meant for advanced users. I’ve decided to return for now and try their milder one - The Godfather possibly. The short handle was inconvenient for me ! The built and appearance is very nice though.
customer_reviews.author: Sameer Arora

customer_reviews.title: BBS!
customer_reviews.text: I've been shaving with a safety razor for a few years and previously I had lower quality equipment. I decided to upgrade and the Chieftain is the real deal! The weight is good and it seems to be well made (based on one shave). If you are a beginner it's in your best interest to read the small manual that comes with the razor and/or watch some videos about how to use the razor so you don't damage your face. Great product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Parks

customer_reviews.title: I was a bit skeptical at first...
customer_reviews.text: After many years of battling with the ever-inflating price of cartridge razors, I finally decided to go the tried and true route and get a safety razor. I wasn't expecting to be blown away by the difference. Gone are the days of post-shaving irritation (head and face). The whole back-of-the-head shaving component will still take some getting used to, but I'm quite pleased with my purchase. This might quickly become my go-to gift for anyone who doesn't already have one! It's a heavy, quality razor. I'm a Vikings Blade supporter for life!
customer_reviews.author: Chuggy4Life

customer_reviews.title: Closest shave of my life
customer_reviews.text: This razor is as sharp as a Japanese kitchen knife! Best, closest shave ever! Glides across my face and leaves the smoothest feeling I’ve never experienced using a Gillette razor. Be warned!! Although I was amazed at how great it works when I finished shaving, I washed my face, turned back around to the mirror and I was literally bleeding all over!! This definitely takes practice to master but well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: No! Cut me badly
customer_reviews.text: Thought this would be a good alternative to paying stupid amounts of money for Gillette blades. Not a smooth shave. Blades dull after 1/4 of my face and then I'm getting cutup and nicked. Not better. Not fun. 1) Handle too short and clunky for my hands. 2) Blades last 1/4 of my face before I was getting cut and nicked. Ok with changing blade every day, but not multiple times during shave.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford Ribaudo

customer_reviews.title: Great safety razor
customer_reviews.text: The weight is perfect, the aggressiveness of the angle and guard is just right. Even with Astra blades it was smooth shaving even with long beard hair. For a beginner it is perfect if you use a less aggressive blade. When the blade holder is open it has play but once you tighten it down its rock solid. The only con I can think of it the blade can clog with long hair think 3 weeks of growth long, just open the top with a twist and a rinse cleans it out. Over all great safety razor would definitely purchase again or possibly go with the more aggressive Viking blades model.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality! And caring staff!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this purchase! The razor is well made and the company cares a lot about its consumers by easing you into the process by providing milder blades. I’m slowly getting the hang of the “wet shave” it’s definitely a learning process. But my skin is so much more clear without removing 2 layers of skin from my “conventional” razor. The product is extremely well made, instructions are thorough, and packaging is of superior quality.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond lacharite

customer_reviews.title: Great quality razor
customer_reviews.text: Love Viking Blade products. My second DE razor from them, first was the godfather, but wanted a closer shave but didn’t want to deal with adjusting the setting for each shave. Well crafted, would like a little more weight in the head but it cuts very well, just a personal preference. No pulling or clogs. Paired with Astra blades
customer_reviews.author: M-Rod

customer_reviews.title: Almost embarrassed it took me this long to discover
customer_reviews.text: I only bought this because my job requires that I shave... a lot. I also couldn't find my cartridges for a decent price and bought these out of frustration. I must admit, Im thankful it worked out. This is the closest shave I've ever had in my life. Mind you, it will add some time to your shave because you do have to pay a bit more attention while using this blade, but after a week or two.... you should be a pro. If nothing else, this blade will save you a lot of money compared to the cartridges and that alone should peak your interest
customer_reviews.author: Kevin W.

customer_reviews.title: **CHEAP** - DON’T waste your $$
customer_reviews.text: Bottom screw unscrews WAY too easily - any movement of my hand (which happens often, since I AM shaving), causes the top butterfly fastener to open, thereby loosening the blade and causing razor burn and sideways-running slices. Vikings Blade markets this as a high-quality item and I *really* wanted to like it(!!) but after six months of trying to finagle with the cheap hinges and poor quality, I have finally decided to invest my time and skin in something worth my while.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A fine well balanced shaver providing a very close, comfortable shave.
customer_reviews.text: The razor is well balanced and provides a close shave. By letting the weight of the shaver do the work there is no need to press down to do the shaving. The blade is very sharp. If you have never or in along time not used a safety razor be careful and let the shaver do the job and try not to press the blade against your face, as you may nick due to the sharpness of the blade. Once the proper use of this fine instrument is mastered you most likely will not return to the many blades or electric shaver.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen A. Szadek

customer_reviews.title: Great razor but a bit of a learning curve
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this transition to safety razor (after 35 years of disposable adherence) but it requires a lot of care. My first experience gave me the closest shave I have received in years. Unfortunately, my overconfidence got the better of me on the second shave and I hacked myself quite badly. Let me be clear about my situation: It has ABSOLUTELY NOTHING to do with workmanship, but, rather, my own inexperience. I am looking forward to getting better at using this razor, but I will first need to let some of my self-inflicted injuries heal completely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: New to using this
customer_reviews.text: This is great. After having a beard for the past 20 years it's like I'm learning how to shave all over again. A few missteps but this thing is magnificent. I actually enjoy shaving and will run around all naked faced again after two decades. Cannot recommend this enough and I know what I'm getting my family for christmas this year.
customer_reviews.author: Dj Wysh

customer_reviews.title: KIng of the Hill!
customer_reviews.text: OK, so now I see what all the talk is about. Got the Chieftain this week after purchasing the Chieftain JR. earlier. I thought the JR would be the razor for me. And I do like its size and agility. But the Chieftain takes my shave to the next level. During the first shave (which was purposely done with VB mild blades) I could tell no real difference in closeness. However, after the completed two pass shave it was noticeable closer that ever before. Can't wait to graduate to a more aggressive blade and see the difference. Oh, and buy the way IT'S KNOCK OUT BEAUTIFUL! And to Old Robert and Lars, keep up the good work.
customer_reviews.author: Woofy50

customer_reviews.title: Stop throwing $$$ away, get one!!
customer_reviews.text: I regret not buying this earlier! Best of all, you don't need to get the pre-shave oil, soap, badger brush and after shave balm that they recommend (though go ahead and try it, spoil yourself). I took this out, installed one of the included blades and got right to it with generic aerosol shave gel from the supermarket, used the short strokes and very light pressure and a 30 degree angle. THE FIRST TIME it shaved as close or closer than a Mach 3 and it even rivals Fusion Proglide! I can't wait to drop in a Feather blade to see what this baby really is capable of. BUY THIS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Boomerang86

customer_reviews.title: Need some work in Quality Control and Assurance
customer_reviews.text: It looks like a great razor, but they’ve got some quality control issues. I bought this razor from here one year ago, and it arrived a bit different from the one pictured. The razor I received had only two channels under the blade and it doesn’t say “The Chieftain” on the top. Still works fine, but not quite what I paid for. I saw in the Q&A section that they were supposedly having issues with their manufacturer. What is Vikings Blade planning to do for their customers who purchased razors during that time and received products that weren’t to standard?
customer_reviews.author: jl0038

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and high quality!
customer_reviews.text: The newest razor in my line-up and I love it. I was aware that it is more aggressive than say the Merkur 34C so I did nick myself a few times, but that was due to me getting a little over-confident. I could also have used a milder blade than the Persona surgical prep blades, but I was feeling adventurous. In any case, it is staying in rotation! And by the way, it is a beautiful razor and I love the butterfly doors which make loading blades very convenient! Also, the included travel case with magnetic flap and internal mirror is a very nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Roach

customer_reviews.title: The perfect razor. Bloody beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: WOW!!!! This razor is seriously beautiful. A a newbie to this style of razor (normally a Gellette kinda guy) i was worried it may be difficult and take too long to shave. i was so wrong! It is super easy to use and is actually faster than a normal shave as this razor does not get clogged up like a cartridge on a gillette razor. People worry about the length of the handle and let me tell you it's the perfect size. My only regret is i wish i discovered this old school style razor earlier. Thanks a bunch!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Never going back
customer_reviews.text: Overall, very well crafted. The head appears to be actual brass, and the mechanics are smooth. Heavy weight in the hand. Very manly. I’ve had a mach 3 for 20 years, which works well but cartridges are expensive and if I wait a week between shaves it pulls my hair. Not this, it’s smooth as butter and blades cheap as dirt!
customer_reviews.author: Phil

product_meta.title: VIKINGS BLADE The Chieftain Double Edge Safety Razor (Neutrally Aggressive)
feature_bullets: This is THE original Chieftain: a time-tested and proven perfect all-rounder razor with medium aggression
20% Heavier. 150% Smoother. 200% more Eco-Friendly than other mass-produced lookalikes
HIGH-end materials, HEAVY construction & SUPERB quality control
Luxury case with mirror with a pack of 5x Swedish 13C26 steel mild blades
Great and meaningful for all occasions: Christmas, Father's Day etc
